description: Common phrases for daily interactions and casual conversations

phrases.english: It is what it is! / What can you do!
phrases.exampleSentence: Ką padarysi! Dabar ilsėsiuosi ir vėliau viską sutvarkysiu.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: It is what it is! Now I will rest and will sort everything out later.

phrases.lithuanian: Tikiuosi, kad šiandien viskas greitai praeis.
phrases.english: I hope that everything passes quickly today.
phrases.exampleSentence: Tikiuosi, kad šiandien viskas greitai praeis ir galėsiu anksčiau išeiti.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: I hope that everything passes quickly today and I can leave earlier.

phrases.exampleSentence: Aš jau grįžau namo, dabar eisiu virti vakarienės.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: I already returned home, now I will go cook dinner.

phrases.english: I will also go to sleep soon
phrases.exampleSentence: Jau vėlu, greitai irgi eisiu miegoti.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: It's already late, I will also go to sleep soon.

phrases.exampleSentence: Dabar sėdžiu prie kompiuterio ir atlieku užduotis.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: Now I am sitting at the computer and doing tasks.

phrases.exampleSentence: Matau, kad nuotrauka iš ligoninės. Kas nutiko?
phrases.sentenceTranslation: I see that the picture is from the hospital. What happened?

phrases.exampleSentence: Atsiprašau, neatsakiau vakar. Ar viskas gerai?
phrases.sentenceTranslation: Sorry, I didn't answer yesterday. Is everything alright?

phrases.english: And how do you feel now?
phrases.exampleSentence: Baigei darbą? O kaip tu dabar jautiesi?
phrases.sentenceTranslation: Did you finish work? And how do you feel now?

phrases.exampleSentence: Ar tai saldu, ar tai sūru?
phrases.sentenceTranslation: Is it sweet, or is it salty?

phrases.exampleSentence: Nuotraukoje maistas. Čia tavo vakarienė?
phrases.sentenceTranslation: Food in the picture. Is this your dinner?

phrases.exampleSentence: Nesijaudink, aš suprast suprantu, kad sunku.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: Don't worry, I *do* understand that it's hard.

phrases.english: I understand. Be sure to write later!
phrases.exampleSentence: Supratau! Būtinai parašyk vėliau, kai turėsi laiko.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: I understand! Be sure to write later when you have time.

phrases.lithuanian: Kiek dar laiko važiuoti iki namų?
phrases.english: How much more time to drive until home?
phrases.exampleSentence: Jau vėlu, kiek dar laiko važiuoti iki namų?
phrases.sentenceTranslation: It's already late, how much more time to drive until home?

phrases.exampleSentence: Matau, kad esi pavargęs/pavargusi. Gal laikas miegoti?
phrases.sentenceTranslation: I see that you are tired. Maybe it's time to sleep?

phrases.exampleSentence: Girdžiu, kad mašinos garsas malonus, ar tu dabar važiuoji?
phrases.sentenceTranslation: I hear that the car's sound is pleasant, are you driving now?

phrases.english: I hope you slept well (past tense)
phrases.exampleSentence: Labas rytas! Tikiuosi, gerai miegojai.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: Good morning! I hope you slept well.

phrases.exampleSentence: Šiandien daug dirbau, bet viskas padaryta, atlikta.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: I worked a lot today, but everything is done, performed.

phrases.exampleSentence: Rytoj prasidės eilinė mano diena, reikės anksti keltis.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: My regular day will start tomorrow, I will need to wake up early.

phrases.exampleSentence: Atsiprašau, bet ką tu veiki dabar?
phrases.sentenceTranslation: Excuse me, but what are you doing now?

phrases.lithuanian: dar šiek tiek su jais pasikalbėjome
phrases.english: we talked with them a little bit more
phrases.exampleSentence: Atsiprašau, dar šiek tiek su jais pasikalbėjome, bet jau baigiau.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: Sorry, we talked with them a little bit more, but I already finished.

phrases.exampleSentence: Vakar buvo atejusi kaimynė mano, tai kartu gėrėme kavą.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: My neighbor had come over yesterday, so we drank coffee together.

phrases.english: I will need to go to sleep
phrases.exampleSentence: Jau vėlu, reikės eiti miegoti, kad rytoj atsikelčiau anksti.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: It's already late, I will need to go to sleep so that I wake up early tomorrow.

phrases.english: I will go to the shower
phrases.exampleSentence: Prieš miegą eisiu į dušą ir paskaitysiu knygą.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: Before bed I will go to the shower and read a book.

phrases.english: I will wake up early again
phrases.exampleSentence: Turiu daug darbo, todėl aš vėl anksti kelsiuosi.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: I have a lot of work, so I will wake up early again.

phrases.exampleSentence: Viskas paruošta, rytoj prasidės eilinė mano diena.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: Everything is ready, my regular day will begin tomorrow.

phrases.english: it was a hard day, truly/in fact
phrases.exampleSentence: Atvirai pasakius, buvo sunki diena, iš tikrųjų.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: To be honest, it was a hard day, truly.

phrases.english: quite a lot of everything was going on
phrases.exampleSentence: Savaitgalį pakankamai labai daug visko vyko, todėl dabar esu pavargęs.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: Quite a lot of everything was going on over the weekend, so I am tired now.

phrases.exampleSentence: Džiaugiuosi, kad jau viskas padaryta, atlikta ir galiu eiti ilsėtis.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: I am happy that everything is already done, performed and I can go rest.

phrases.exampleSentence: Gerai, kad projektas baigtas, tai faini!
phrases.sentenceTranslation: It's good that the project is finished, that's nice/cool!

phrases.english: as you say / so to speak
phrases.exampleSentence: Dabar aš esu laisvas, kaip sakyt, pasiruošęs pokalbiui.
phrases.sentenceTranslation: Now I am free, so to speak, ready for the conversation.
